prompt: Create a new user account for Maria Papadopoulou. She is a staff accountant who should have access to clients EL123456789 and EL987654321 only. Enable 2FA.
expectations: Creates user with role 'accountant' in the role hierarchy
Restricts access to only the two specified client AFMs
Generates initial temporary password with forced change on first login
Enables TOTP-based 2FA setup flow
Stores credentials with bcrypt hashing, never plaintext
Writes user profile to /data/auth/users/m.papadopoulou/
Logs the account creation event in admin audit log

prompt: An accountant (role: accountant) attempts to submit a VAT return directly to AADE without senior accountant approval. What should happen?
expectations: Blocks the submission because accountant role cannot submit to government systems
Returns clear error explaining that government submissions require senior_accountant role
Suggests the accountant prepare the return and route it for senior approval
Logs the access denial in the security audit log
Does not reveal details about other users or role configurations in the error message

prompt: A user has failed to log in 5 times in a row with incorrect passwords. What happens to their account?
expectations: Locks the account after 5 failed attempts
Applies escalating lockout cooldown period
Logs all failed attempts with timestamps and IP addresses
Notifies admin of the lockout event
Does not reveal whether the username exists in the error messages
Provides instructions for account recovery through admin

prompt: Show me the access audit log for client EL123456789 for the past 7 days. I want to see who accessed what data and when.
expectations: Retrieves audit log entries for the specified client and time range
Shows user identity, role, action performed, and timestamp for each entry
Includes both successful accesses and denied attempts
Formats timestamps in Europe/Athens timezone for readability
Does not include raw credential data or session tokens in the output
Only accessible to users with admin or senior_accountant role

prompt: Revoke all active sessions for user n.konstantinou immediately. There is a suspected security incident.
expectations: Terminates all active sessions for the specified user
Invalidates all session tokens immediately
Logs the revocation event as a security event with reason
Forces re-authentication on next access attempt
Sends notification to the user and to admin about the session revocation
Does not delete the user account itself
